title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 09 November 2015 - XWiki
content: has quit 00:16  has quit 02:53  has quit 06:37  has quit 06:58  has joined #xwiki 08:26  has joined #xwiki 08:40  has joined #xwiki 08:48  has quit 09:04  has joined #xwiki 09:26  has joined #xwiki 09:38  has joined #xwiki 09:42  has joined #xwiki 09:46  mflorea: did you noticed some error in generated by the release script ? looks like there is still a bug in the part that put back parent version (all parent are 7.3-rc-1 in 7.3.x branches) 09:47  I didn't notice any problem 09:47  in the console log 09:47  I din 09:47  I didn't check the 7.3.x branch afterwards 09:50  release script is not the easiest thing to validate without actually doing a release... 09:50  fixing 6.4 branch too 09:53  has joined #xwiki 09:53  is now known as 09:54  hmm I think I know what is wrong 10:07  guys would be great if other could review the release script too 10:07  parent update should be ok for next release I think 10:14  has joined #xwiki 10:14  has joined #xwiki 10:32  is it only me or search.maven.org is down ? 10:39  it works for me but quite slowly 10:39  it seems to be back actually but yes slow 10:52  has joined #xwiki 10:57  gdelhumeau: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/316d4972c2c2b9d8f375b17a0b2a1c0303c7e5d7 ;) 10:59  tmortagne: indeed 10:59  Should I change the release script? 11:01  gdelhumeau: add the now profile to the others yes 11:02  gdelhumeau: the profiles are listed twice in that command (just in case) 11:03  has quit 11:03  has joined #xwiki 11:07  has joined #xwiki 11:23  sorry 11:58  hello 11:58  since an update from 7.1 to 7.2, the title of the webhome is now "$services.localization.render('xe.home.title')" 11:59  any idea how to fix that? 12:10  has joined #xwiki 12:10  has joined #xwiki 12:21  solved, I had to add the "programming" right to everyone 12:22  Slashman: don't give programming right to everyone, the new right is script right 12:22  programming right is equivalent to being root 12:28  tmortagne: okay, good to know... changed to script right 12:28  thanks 12:29  basically script right is a right that everyone used to have and that we decide to separate so that it's possible to allow people to contribute content without writing script 12:30  okay so it's intended that the script right is not given to all users when updating? 12:30  I'm not sure when the script right should not be given, do you have a jira ticket in mind with a use case? 12:31  Slashman: not exactly, the right is given to everyone by default but you probably had conflict on XWikiPreference and kept previous configuration 12:31  oh I see, I did have a conflict indeed 12:35  as for the use case you can do lots of stuff with scripting that some admin could not want even if they are not security issue exactly: set some variable to disable part of the UI like comments, override some translations for a given page, etc. 12:37  it also prevent any exploit of some security flow not fixed yet in the product or introduced by some extension or custom script 12:48  has quit 12:49  okay, thanks for the insight 12:52  has joined #xwiki 13:17  I have an issue with the colibri skin when updating from 7.1 to 7.2: the following warn appear in logs: "WARN  o.x.v.i.DefaultVelocityEngine  - Deprecated usage of method [com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki.parseContent] in 79:/skins/colibri/login.vm@25,47" 13:17  I never get the login prompt 13:18  I'm stuck at "XWiki is initializing (50%)..." 13:19  I changed the default skin to flamingo in xwiki.cfg and restarted tomcat but it didn't change anything... I think that the skin was changed in the config, any idea how I can force the use of the flamingo skin so I can get the login prompt? 13:22  okay, seems to work after a while! 13:34  has joined #xwiki 13:38  tmortagne: is there any reason we still have https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/master/xwiki-commons-core/pom.xml#L187 they seem to have been added by XCOMMONS-810 which was fixed in 7.1RC1. Is the fix version wrong or did we forgot to remove them? 13:40  has joined #xwiki 13:40  they should have been removed when 7.1 final was released no? 13:40  mflorea: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/master/xwiki-commons-core/xwiki-commons-extension/xwiki-commons-extension-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/extension/Extension.java#L236 13:41  you are probably mixing with something else 13:41  how did you ended up with http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-810 ? 13:41  the right one is XCOMMONS-844 13:43  arr, I was looking at the wrong issues, my bad 14:21  has quit 14:22  has joined #xwiki 14:48  has quit 15:31  has joined #xwiki 15:45  has joined #xwiki 15:47  has quit 16:15  has quit 16:25  has quit 16:43  has joined #xwiki 16:47  has joined #xwiki 16:47  Hi guys, I installed xwiki enterprise 7.2 and I just realize that some of the link in the admin page are not working, here an example Edit Mode Settings 16:47  the problem is the "&", other links with only "&" works fine 16:50  any idea where I could fix this? 16:54  pomo: hi 16:54  thanks for reporting, this issue was actually fixed already 16:55  if you upgrade to 7.3RC1 you won't have the problem anymore 16:56  found it thanks vmassol1 16:56  https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/174ec8e1afc40ff47ea6bf3de03183c145b42af6 16:56  I prefer to stay with the stable version, thanks for your time ;) cheers 16:56  ahah fun 16:57  7.2 is way less stavble than 7.3M1 16:57  :S 16:57  or 7.3M2 or of course 7.3RC1 16:57  :) 16:57  you should check the release notes of 7.2 16:57  you'll see it's not a recommended version 16:57  ok then, I'll go with 7.3 then, is it ok for production? 16:58  if you're after production you should use 7.4.x 16:58  oops 16:58  6.4.x 16:58  this is our LTS 16:58  I see, thanks ;) 16:58  you could also wait till 7.3 is out 16:59  (in a few days hopefully) 16:59  great then, I'll start familiarizing with 7.3 16:59  cool :) 17:00  you are doing a great tool, I'm really happy, and you also should be! Keep it up guys ;) bye! 17:07  has left #xwiki 17:49  has quit 17:57  has quit 17:59  has quit 18:06  has quit 18:10  has joined #xwiki 18:11  my xwiki install does not currently send "forgot password" emails. The queue on the "Mail Sending Status" page is empty, which lead me to believe that the messages were sent. But I don't know where to look for logs and the logging configuration page of the admin panel has 1372 parameters and no search. Can you guys point me to how to troubleshoot mail issues? Thanks! 18:19  has quit 18:54  thisismatt: hi, indeed if the status page is empty it means the mail was sent succesfully 18:55  the only logs that exist in xwiki are the servlet container logs (catalina.out if you're using tomcat) 18:55  you should check the mail server logs porbably 18:55  \*probably 18:55  (smtp server used in the config) 18:56  you can also set the mallc config to keep success messages in the status page 18:56  s/mallc/mail/ 19:02  has quit 19:03  thanks vmassol1 I'll take a look in the catalina logs 19:08  has joined #xwiki 19:12  has quit 19:17  has joined #xwiki 19:18  has quit 19:27  has joined #xwiki 19:30  has quit 19:33  has quit 19:36  has quit 20:03  has quit 20:21  has joined #xwiki 20:33  has quit 20:38  has joined #xwiki 21:18  has quit 21:18  has joined #xwiki 21:20  has quit 21:24  has quit 22:08  has joined #xwiki 22:08  so in digging around, I found the mail files being written on the system. But there were WARN lines in the catalina logs that look like they were generated by this code 22:08  https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-mail/xwiki-platform-mail-send/xwiki-platform-mail-send-storage/src/main/java/org/xwiki/mail/internal/DatabaseMailListener.java#L179 22:08  I am sending mail from AWS SES, which (unfortunately) has no logging. Is there a way I can test this from the command line? I can telnet into the SMTP server, so that seems fine. Any other thoughts? 23:45  has joined #xwiki 23:47  What is the significance of the wiki name "local"? I see references to that in many parts of the XWiki code. 23:48  hi debajit. Do you have an example? 23:50  https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/usersandgroups/usersandgroups.js#L231 23:51  no idea, first time I see this :) 23:51  I see 23:51  Another example is here https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/js/xwiki/usersandgroups/usersandgroups.js#L259 23:52  any example in another file? 23:52  has joined #xwiki 23:52  to find out you need to trace its origin 23:53  for ex trace the displayUsers() method and see what row contains 23:53  (I mean the callers of displayUsers()) 23:54  vmassol: Okay, let me do that. Thanks!
